DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Summary Fourth Course Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name for a group of subfields that describe the fourth course or set of subsequent therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Summary Fourth Course
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The fourth course or set of subsequent therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points; a summary.:Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points; a summary._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points; a summary.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subsq RX 4th Course Codes Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: As of January 1, 2003, COC no longer support Subsequent Therapy data items. Group names appear only in the data dictionary and Appendix E. Subfields: Subsq RX 4th Course Surg [1711], Subsq RX 4th Course Rad [1712], Subsq RX 4th Course Chemo [1713], Subsq RX 4th Course Horm [1714], Subsq RX 4th Course BRM [1715], Subsq RX 4th Course Oth [1716]

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
